intro: Corchorus subargentus, commonly known as silverleaf dock, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Botanically, it belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes other plants with similar leaf structures and flowering patterns.
